metadata.Title: CVE-2017-6347 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
The ip_cmsg_recv_checksum function in net/ipv4/ip_sockglue.c in the Linuxkernel before 4.10.1 has incorrect expectations about skb data layout,which allows local users to cause a denial of service (buffer over-read) orpossibly have unspecified other impact via crafted system calls, asdemonstrated by use of the MSG_MORE flag in conjunction with loopback UDPtransmission.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-6347` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-164-generic - 4.4.0-75.96~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-75.96~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-lowlatency - 4.4.0-75.96~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-75.96~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-75.96~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-75.96~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-75.96~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-164-generic - 4.4.0-75.96~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-164-lowlatency - 4.4.0-75.96~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1054-aws - 4.4.0-1002.2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1059-azure - 4.15.0-1023.24~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-grouper: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-maguro: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-mako: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-manta: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-flo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-lts-utopic: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-lts-wily: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-75.96~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty/esm, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1002.2').
linux-azure package in trusty/esm, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1023.24~14.04.1').
